events.title: Battle of Marathon
events.description: The Battle of Marathon occurred during the first Persian invasion of Greece, where the Athenians achieved a decisive victory against the Persian forces.
events.significance: Marked a pivotal moment in the Greco-Persian Wars, demonstrating the effectiveness of the Greek hoplite phalanx and boosting Greek confidence and unity.

events.title: Henry Hudson Discovers the Hudson River
events.description: English explorer Henry Hudson entered what is now known as the Hudson River, exploring the region for the Dutch East India Company.
events.significance: This exploration led to Dutch colonization in the area, eventually founding New Amsterdam, which later became New York City.

events.title: Groundbreaking for Pentagon Building
events.description: The construction of the Pentagon, the headquarters of the United States Department of Defense, officially began in Arlington, Virginia.
events.significance: The Pentagon became a symbol of the U.S. military and played a central role in defense operations during World War II and beyond.

events.title: Famine in Somalia Declared International Emergency
events.description: The United Nations declared a famine in Somalia as a result of civil war and drought, prompting international humanitarian intervention.
events.significance: Led to widespread humanitarian aid efforts and peacekeeping missions aimed at alleviating the crisis and stabilizing the region.

events.title: Condoleezza Rice Becomes First African-American Woman U.S. Secretary of State
events.description: Condoleezza Rice was sworn in as the 66th United States Secretary of State under President George W. Bush.
events.significance: Her appointment marked a historic milestone for African-American women in high-ranking U.S. government positions.
